instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no S5
threads.message:
Liquid damage mainly around LCD circuit. Has been worked on at some point in the past.

BIOS chip looks well toasted.
Bodge wire on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pin 7 <SIGNAL>VCCSAS0_SREF</SIGNAL> connecting to <CAPACITOR>C7103</CAPACITOR> & <RESISTOR>R7147</RESISTOR>

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = ok
3V342 = ok

No S5 rails and no S5 enables, no pulsing at all and can't find a short.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no S5
threads.message:
ok is not a value....
Got a green light? 
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no S5
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 6436"]ok is not a value....[/QUOTE]

And I just seen the schematic says 12.8 for this rail.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8V2
PP3V42 = 3V4
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> nothing
Green light yes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no S5
threads.message: It should be 8.6V. SMC has no data connection to the battery/<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. Could be corrosion under SMC or dead SMC.
